title: Feinstein Proposal Would Lock In Anti-Torture Measures
teaser: The CIA's excruciating interrogations of suspected terrorists, widely seen as torture, are detailed as official acts in the Senate report released last month. Now Sen. Dianne Feinstein, who spearheaded that report, wants to prevent such acts from ever happening again. She's proposing legislation and administrative moves for which her Republican colleagues see little need and which activists deem too timid.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
